channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Historic North Carolina village submerged under water after Hurricane Helen brings heavy rain
item.description: Severe flooding from Hurricane Helene has submerged Asheville's historic Biltmore Village in North Carolina. The area is experiencing significant damage, power outages, and road closures. Over 200 people have been rescued statewide. President Biden has approved emergency declarations for several states to aid in rescue and recovery operations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump attacks Kamala Harris over immigration and US border policy at Wisconsin rally
item.description: During a speech in Wisconsin, former US President Donald Trump targeted Vice President Kamala Harris over immigration issues and border policy failures. He accused her of allowing illegal border crossings and promised to address these problems if re-elected. Trump also made personal attacks on Harris, questioning her mental capacity and racial identity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japanese fans bid farewell to beloved panda pair before their return to China
China is striking deals to cement its role as Asia's trade hub
item.description: China is making strides towards becoming Asia's trade and transportation hub by planning rail lines across Central Asia and Vietnam, while seeking to reopen a port on the Sea of Japan. The initiatives face hurdles including political instability in neighboring countries like Kyrgyzstan, labor shortages in Russia due to the Ukraine war, and skepticism from North Korea.

item.title: US, Asia-Pacific nations hold joint maritime exercises in South China Sea
item.description: The armed forces of five nations—Philippines, United States, Australia, Japan, and New Zealand—conducted joint maritime exercises in the South China Sea to boost military interoperability. This exercise comes amid escalating tensions with China over disputed regions like Scarborough Shoal. Concurrently, China's military also conducted drills in the contested waters.

item.title: Shooting leaves 17 dead in eastern South Africa
item.description: South African police said Saturday they were launching a manhunt after 17 people were shot dead in a town in the east of the country. In mid-September, seven members of a family, including three children, were shot dead at their home in KwaZulu-Natal, also in the east of the country.

item.title: Iran's Khamenei vows revenge over Nasrallah's killing
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader, promised retaliation for Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's killing and declared five days of mourning. He affirmed that Nasrallah's fight against Israel would continue. Iranian officials accused the U.S. of complicity due to its support for Israel, while security in Iran has been tightened.

item.title: Shots in the air, wails and disbelief in Beirut after Hezbollah head killed
item.description: Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, Hezbollah's leader, was killed in an Israeli airstrike on the group's headquarters in Beirut. His death has left supporters in shock and disbelief, prompting gunfire and shop closures. Lebanon's army has tightened security across the capital as tensions rise.

item.title: Hindu minority's quest for political representation in Bangladesh as it mulls the idea of a political party
Russian attacks kill top judge and three others in Ukraine's Kharkiv, officials say
item.description: In Ukraine's Kharkiv region, two Russian assaults claimed four lives, including a Supreme Court judge. An airstrike on Slatyne caused three fatalities and injured at least three others. Meanwhile, a drone attack on Kozacha Lopan killed the judge and injured three women. The attacks also damaged civilian infrastructure.

item.title: Missiles fired at Israel from Yemen and Lebanon in response to Hezbollah leader Nasrallah's death: Top developments
item.description: Yemen's Houthi rebels fired a missile at Israel's Ben Gurion Airport, targeting the Israeli Prime Minister after attending the UNGA meeting. This marks their second attack in two days following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death in an Israeli airstrike. International leaders call for ceasefires and diplomatic solutions to avoid further escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Months of intelligence, a few minutes of bombs: How Israel killed Hezbollah chief Nasrallah
item.description: Israeli leaders had been aware of Hassan Nasrallah's location for months and chose to strike this past week due to a limited window of opportunity. Over 80 bombs were dropped in the attack, resulting in the deaths of Nasrallah and Ali Karaki, a top Hezbollah commander. The operation was planned amid cease-fire discussions with American counterparts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasrallah made Hezbollah a formidable force
Floods, landslides kill 66 people in Nepal
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Labour MP Rosie Duffield resigns, accuses UK PM Starmer of 'hypocrisy'
item.description: Rosie Duffield resigned from the Labour Party, accusing Prime Minister Keir Starmer of hypocrisy for accepting gifts while cutting winter heating payments for pensioners. She criticized his policies as inconsistent with Labour values. The controversy has caused friction within the party, especially during their first conference since regaining power.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hezbollah leader Nasrallah killed: Israeli PM Netanyahu says 'settled score'
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that Israel had "settled the score" with the assassination of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in a Beirut airstrike. Netanyahu highlighted Nasrallah's role in numerous deaths, including Americans and French citizens. He asserted that eliminating Nasrallah was essential for achieving Israel's objectives and facilitating the return of hostages captured by Hamas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasrallah, Hezbollah chief for 32 years, killed in Israel airstrike
item.description: Hezbollah confirmed that its leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Beirut. The strike also resulted in the deaths of other Hezbollah commanders and an Iranian general. Israel announced plans to intensify its operations against Hezbollah, leading to substantial displacement among Lebanese and Israelis amid escalating tensions.

item.title: 'More high profile than...': Attorney says Diddy's secret tapes being sold in Hollywood
item.description: ​“There already have been tapes leaking around Hollywood being shopped around, but one particular person contacted me to shop a particular video,” Mitchell-Kidd said. “I can tell the video was pornographic. This was in his Atlanta home, and it does seem like the person isn’t looking into the video. To me, it doesn’t seem like that person knows they’re being videotaped.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Measure of justice...': US President Joe Biden on Hezbollah leader Nasrallah's death
item.description: US President Joe Biden termed the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli airstrike as 'a measure of justice.' The incident follows Hezbollah's engagement in the conflict post-Hamas’s October 7, 2023, attack on Israel. Biden reiterated US support for Israel and highlighted ongoing diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle sends emails to her staff at 5 am but is kind enough to...
item.description: ​"My working day may not be your working day. Please do not feel obliged to reply to this email outside your normal working hours," Meghan writes this in her mails. Her staff claimed she is flexible and fair-minded like that. Meghan has around 16 staffers working for production on various Netflix projects, podcasts, the Archewell Foundation, and communications. Meghan shares credit and writes personal email thanking her staff for their contribution, an ex-staffer said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
